greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of chi(-x)^2 * chi(-x^2) in powers of x where chi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(1/6) * eta(q)^2 / (eta(q^2) * eta(q^4)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (576 t)) = 8^(1/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A098613. - _Michael Somos_, Sep 07 2015
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x, x^2]^2 QPochhammer[ x^2, x^4], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 07 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^2 / (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^4 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 27 2008
